title: Senior Payroll Manager
content:
We‚Äôre hiring for a Senior Payroll Manager to join our global Payroll Team. The role will be based in Austin, Texas.
Reporting to the Global Head of Payroll (based in the UK), you‚Äôll lead a group of Payroll Specialists to support our employees across the Americas, covering New York, Austin, Tampa, Brazil and Mexico.
It‚Äôs a unique opportunity to have an impact on Wise‚Äôs mission, support our employees in all things payroll and help save our customers millions of dollars. 
Wise has already pioneered new ways for people to transfer money across borders and currencies. Our customers can also manage their hard-earned money with the world‚Äôs first platform to offer true multi-currency banking. We‚Äôre 5000+ Wisers strong, with over 70 nationalities working in 25+ locations around the globe! We‚Äôre looking for a leader who lives our values, will help grow our culture, and drive our mission forward! üöÄ
Your mission

We‚Äôre evolving our payroll model - you‚Äôll have the opportunity to bring your operational skills and strategic leadership to help us build the payroll team as we continue to grow and scale.
You‚Äôll be accountable for a group of payroll specialists around the globe, leading their development and supporting them day-to-day. 
You‚Äôll work to optimize processes and create efficiencies in our current ways of working and/or develop new ways while we implement payroll processing using our new global system while tackling tricky topics like compliance, internal audit and reconciliation across multiple countries for Wise. 
You‚Äôll need to call on the functional experts across the People Team to assist you as we expand. This will involve high levels of collaboration across People Operations, Reward, Recruitment, Analytics & Technology teams. 
You‚Äôll partner with our multiple third-party payroll teams and their advisors to identify solutions, reduce errors and process payroll more efficiently. 

The specifics

Implement, maintain, and review payroll processing systems to ensure timely and accurate processing of payroll transactions including salaries, benefits, garnishments, taxes, and other deductions.
Prepare and maintain accurate records and reports of payroll transactions.
Ensure compliance with federal, state/provincial, and local payroll, wage, and hour laws and best practices.
Assist the company‚Äôs audits by providing records and documentation as needed.
Identify and recommend updates to payroll processing systems and procedures.
Work with the Finance team to ensure payroll entries are properly recorded and reconciled to the general ledger.
Collaborate closely with the wider People and Finance Teams.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Ensure that the Americas payroll process is handled biweekly (US, Mexico) / monthly (Brazil)  and is timely and accurate for all employees.
Manage and provide guidance to the Payroll Specialist team.
Process payroll for assigned locations and assign locations to the team according to guidelines stipulated including coordination of the daily payroll operations, clock in and clock out (Workday), and validating data prior to transmission.
Ensure the timely and accurate submission of the following: payroll reports, tax reports, labor reports, garnishments, and 401(k) reports, and any other EBSA requirements. 
Responsible for reporting accurate processing of federal and state wage attachments, garnishments, and child support orders as required.
Generate the payroll tax file and verify mandated returns and remittances for all employees and the employer payroll taxes.
Accurate reporting of Company payroll tax files.
Reconcile and generate the GL accounting entries to accurately record the results of the payroll process with Accounting Team
Troubleshoot and analyze payroll system functions to ensure accuracy and compliance.
Ensure that the Company‚Äôs payroll is in compliance with all Federal, State, and Local laws regarding minimum wage, taxes, etc.
Administer the reporting and payment processes required to reimburse or set up the receivables from employees.
Work closely with The Reward Team on the annual enrollment process and other special related projects as assigned.
Attend various meetings, phone calls to represent the payroll function on behalf of the Company and The People Team as requested.

A bit about you

You‚Äôre a payroll expert across NORTHAM & LATAM - you‚Äôve had accountability and experience in all forms of preparing, processing, correcting, and auditing in all aspects of payroll.

You‚Äôve led people in a high growth, product or service lead company - you know how to deal with ambiguity, shifting priorities and come up with innovative solutions .

Influenced & led a global payroll team - you‚Äôre able to grow, develop, lead and manage a team across multiple locations. 
Desirable: professional payroll certification to demonstrate your expertise and commitment within the field of payroll. 
Data-based, facts-centric decision making experience - you‚Äôll base decisions on data and have clear KPIs for all your plans. 
Passion for payroll, people, and customer service - You‚Äôre not just going through the motions at work, you really love what you do. 
Leadership - You relish the opportunity to lead others and foster their personal and professional development, while striving for outstanding customer service. Always. 
Detail focused - you‚Äôll have an eye for the details and an appreciation of data and analytics, using these two skills to drive your decisions.
Adaptable - you will be as comfortable working with ambiguity as you are with certainly. We need someone who can be agile enough to respond to changing priorities, but be able to hold clear on the long term path ahead.
Challenge status quo - we‚Äôre not a traditional business and we don‚Äôt believe in doing things the same way everyone else does; neither do you. This comes to how we approach setting policies that don't make sense or introducing processes.

You must already be legally authorized to work in the US, we cannot provide visas or sponsorship for this role.
Key Benefits: 

üí∏ Competitive annual salary
üöÄ  Stock options in a profitable company
üíª Hybrid working model ‚Äì 3 days/week working in the office / Flexible working - whether it‚Äôs working from home, school plays or life admin we get that flexibility is essential and you‚Äôre trusted to do the right thing and be responsible
‚úàÔ∏è  Wisers can work remotely for 90 days a year. By ‚Äòremote‚Äô we don‚Äôt just mean from home, but from wherever in the world you choose to
üí™  An annual self-development budget
ü©∫  Medical, dental, & vision insurance ‚Äì including HSA and FSA options
üíù  Company-paid: Life Insurance & AD&D Insurance, Short & Long-Term Disability, and an EAP program
‚òÄÔ∏è  25 accrued days of PTO + 15 accrued paid sick days + 3 me (personal) days + 11 paid banking holidays + a paid volunteer day, annually
üèùÔ∏è  6-week paid sabbatical after 4 years with us
üë∂üèº  18-weeks of paid parental leave, after a year with us
üí∞  401(k) with up to a 4% employer match
Plus more! Click HERE for more info on benefits

Here‚Äôs a few articles for you to read to learn more about our culture and product

‚ÄúWe inspire smart people and we trust them‚Äù
What we do
How we work

#LI-KE1We're people without borders ‚Äî without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive. We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.
Every Wiser should feel that they can be themselves at work. Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to share their contributions towards mission zero and able to progress in their careers.
Having diverse teams that reflect our diverse customer base helps us build a better product. We can be more creative and empathetic to our customer's needs and life experiences and makes sure we leave no-one behind on our journey to mission-zero.
If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.
Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

demographic_questions.description:
The following voluntary questions are intended to help us learn about the various identities and backgrounds that make up the candidates applying to Wise. If you don't feel comfortable answering you can select I don't wish to answer.

Providing us with this information will help us take actions that support underrepresented groups and make sure our hiring process is inclusive and fair for everyone.

The questions may be sensitive to some, please know your survey responses are secure and optional. All data will be handled anonymously, aggregated and not linked to you.There will be no adverse consequences if you do not wish to complete this questionnaire, or if you partially complete it or you select ‘prefer not to say’ to any question. It will in no way impact your opportunity to work for us within the application or hiring process.

Our privacy policy explains how we collect and process your data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you have any questions, please email hiring-privacy@wise.com.
